title: Airships still Canon?
body:
https://i.pinimg.com/736x/ea/7d/39/ea7d392092f0cccbe1ed6812e7768e51--nerdy-things-champions.jpg

In old Piltover, airships were a thing. You can see them in the Jinx music video amongst other things.

Since the lore overhaul however it seems like while Piltover is still an advanced society for Runeterra it isn't as advanced as it used to be. It's been pared down from a Final Fantasy VII psuedo-modern art-style society, complete with skyscrapers and modern zoos to a more Rennaissance/ Victorian Industrial era city. 

Are they still there? Because you can't see them in any Piltover art depicting a skyline. I simply must know...

replies.body: Well, there surely will be some kind of aircrafts from Piltover. I don't know if it's still in form of these airships, it could be that they are even further advanced. We got Camille, who is a fairly modern cyborg, so designing some vehicles to fly shouldn't be such a big deal for Piltover in the end.

Also some rando guy somehow managed to create a machine which knows location of everyone in Runeterra so anything really sounds like something he could do.

Unless he spent all living time on that machine.

"The lifetime's work of Valentina Zindelo, the Incognium Runeterra is a device she claimed was able to locate any individual in the world. Since Zindelo’s mysterious death, many believe her alchemical formulae to have been stolen."

The creator was a she, and it was never operational.  As far as we know.
Or at least that's what the ~~government~~ Riot wants us to think.

But what I want to know is {{champion:42}} , got himself a full blown helichopper and airforce references

Please tell me that {{champion:91}} gets his hands on it, makes it work and finds General Du Cuteaux? Like make it a huge event and then announce the General as a new champion. I'd picture him to be a mobile fighter who would be top or jg and fights with twin blades, like his daughter {{champion:55}} . His attacks wouldn't really have amazing oomph, but he would be able to take people down. Kind of like an {{champion:245}} playstyle. Constantly weaving in and out of combat

Well this is it...
https://i.imgur.com/oaS9Uyg.jpg[]
Not exactly something you can just take and use. And no one knows how to use it anyway, so.

The person who invented the Incognium Runeterra is (as far as I know) missing, she disappeared. Sounds a bit like Camille didn't approve of her invention, if you ask me.

But yeah, with inventions like these, it really shouldn't be hard for Piltovians to build something that can fly. We also know that Riot at least considered giving us a jetpack champion when they designed Husk back then. Even if she got scratched, then it seems that jetpacks at least are technologically possible in these cities. And building an airship is **way** easier than building a combat-functioning jetpack.
Some airships have cannons, but not all of them.  Depends on the company, I think.
Re-watch the cinematic they made for the Gun Goddess {{champion:21}}  skin.  Werent there airships in that?
That's an alternate universe, so non-canon to the normal universe.
{{champion:42}} does it count?

I don't think so...?
I think Corki is just as outdated as old Piltover(he doesn't even look like a Yordle, he looks like a gnome from WoW), and while Piltover is still mentioned in his bio as the reason for him having a flying machine, he's no longer a member of the Piltover faction.

If they ever give him a VU or something to bring him to a more modern standard, the could use him to re-introduce flying machines to the current, canon lore. Or they could just have his flying machine be one of Rumble's inventions. I feel like they could do either, really.

Yeah, but he is a Bandle City/ Piltover cross over aT THE LEAST, and Bandle City has a bit of that silly "works because it does, shut up" engineering behind it. Like Orks in the 40k Universe that build machines that clearly should not be able to function without exploding haphazardly at any moment, but seem to function because the Orks "believe it will" and that creates a psychic resonance that distorts reality. 

If its' Bandle tech in the slightest than it becomes very difficult for us to gauge if it's feasible for Piltovans to replicate it. Corki is just such an old champion and has so little consistency throughout I don't like using him as a reference for anything. He was originally not even a Yordle, he was just a very short old man until they reworked him. Plus he has a passive called "Hextech Munitions". Back in the old days Piltovans used Hextech to toast their bread, the city was dripping with it. Now we are to believe it's a bit rarer and reserved only for those who can afford it so why would Corki make it into bullets?? How is that feasible. I don't know.
